title: Why do people put so much importance on # of games?
body:
It's one thing if you're like X00 games in a low elo like Bronze or Silver. It clearly shows you're hard-stuck and you could use some help. On the other hand, if you're a few hundred games in a pretty high elo, why do people feel like they gotta shit on other people's ranked grind? The way I see it, ranked is more about obtaining and retaining the skills it takes to get and keep a rank, not speeding through the ladder.

It's also discouraging to people that don't play ranked. Like, you worry about losing a game or not making a goal, THEN you worry about "having X amount of games" by the time you make that goal? Personally, I chalk it up to a clear disrespect of other players and their achievements.
